intro: Brassica preslii, commonly known as the Presl's mustard, is a herbaceous plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many edible and ornamental plants. The plant features basal rosettes of dark green, hairy leaves and produces small, yellow flowers in racemes. Its seeds are enclosed in siliques, typical of the mustard family. Brassica preslii is often grown for its ornamental value and has some use in traditional medicine.
